PageTitle: import-rib route next-hop-invariable (BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view)
FuncDef:
The import-rib route next-hop-invariable command configures a VPN instance to retain the original next hops of imported routes when advertising these routes to its IBGP peers.
The undo import-rib route next-hop-invariable command restores the default configuration. The import-rib route next-hop-invariable command configures a VPN instance to retain the original next hops of imported routes when advertising these routes to its IBGP peers. The undo import-rib route next-hop-invariable command restores the default configuration. By default, a VPN instance changes the next hops of imported routes to its own next hop when advertising these routes to its IBGP peers. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view,BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv6 address family view
